articles.title: Georgia State researchers find CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing approach can alter the social behavior of animals - EurekAlert
articles.description: New gene-editing techniques are shedding light on how hormones impact social behavior in animals and possibly, humans. The research was led by Dr. Elliott Albers, Director of the Georgia State Center for Behavioral Neuroscience.
